We must create a culture of accountability at all colleges and universities. The entire school—including those at the very top of the administration—must take responsibility for the college’s value to students and taxpayers.

Three for-profit college chains have collapsed in recent months, leaving students with worthless or nonexistent credits and degrees. That's why it's now more important than ever that the #HigherEd Act protects students and taxpayers from risky, profit-motivated operations.

There are so many different types of schools and students who attend them. We must ensure that our reauthorization of the Higher Education Act includes an accountability system that is as nuanced as our schools and our students.

In addition to the almost $130 billion spent by taxpayers in higher education—students and families invest immense time and financial resources. We must ensure colleges are being held accountable for student success.

I’m going to keep fighting to ensure the @NLRB and the @USEEOC represent all voices—not just those of corporations. I urge every man, woman, and worker who believes that workers should have a voice to join me.

As our nation is grappling with how to address the epidemic of sexual assault & harassment in the workplace, hamstringing the @USEEOC—the agency responsible for protecting workers’ rights & safety—is absolutely the wrong message to send to women, to workers, and to businesses.

The @SenateGOP jammed through Republican nominees to the @NLRB without Mr. Pearce, the Democratic minority nominee—and they allowed one Senator to block Ms. Feldblum's nomination to the @USEEOC, meaning this critical civil rights agency was unable to do its most impactful work.

The @USEEOC and @NLRB are critical agencies responsible for helping protecting workers’ rights, and yet @SenateGOP were more interested in tilting the playing field even more in favor of corporations than providing the EEOC and the NLRB with balanced voices.

I also object to the Senate moving on Republican labor nominees without approving nominations for the @USEEOC and the @NLRB. Even though Chai Feldblum and Mark Pearce were highly qualified nominees and respected by their peers, @SenateGOP refused to give them a vote.

Cheryl Stanton has a long history of siding with employers when they’ve violated workers’ rights, & she should not lead the division that enforces some of our nation's most important workplace laws, including the federal minimum wage, child labor laws, & family & medical leave.

Heading to the Senate floor to speak about my opposition to the nomination of Cheryl Stanton to serve as Administrator for the @USDOL's Wage and Hour Division. I'm voting NO on her nomination and I urge my colleagues to do the same.

Once again, @SenateGOP is rubber stamping President Trump’s misguided agenda by packing our federal courts and other important gov't positions with extreme conservatives committed to advancing a hard-right, ideological agenda. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/04/06/this-week-republican-senate-went-nuclear-again-now-it-can-speed-up-confirming-conservative-judges/ …

It’s well past time that we take action to prevent workplace harassment and ensure that ALL workers have the protections and support to stand up for their rights.

Whether you're the only woman on the board, or a janitor or a farm worker, and no matter your gender, race, religion, sexual orientation, or age, or whether you have a disability or are a veteran—you should be treated fairly, respectfully, and with dignity. #BeHEARD pic.twitter.com/o0YU6AaTT2 – at Dirksen Senate Building

The #BeHEARD Act will:
✔️ establish standards to strengthen harassment prevention in workplaces nationwide
✔️ empower workers to come forward by providing new resources
✔️ safeguard anti-discrimination laws so that ALL workers are protected under our civil rights laws pic.twitter.com/C0E23SZD1M

There are millions of workers who aren't protected under our civil rights laws—and far too many are silenced by mandatory non-disclosure agreements. With the #BeHEARD Act, we want to shine a spotlight on these abuses of power across ALL industries. pic.twitter.com/BcD8bpoy7o – at Dirksen Senate Building

This budget continues the Trump Admin's trend of ideology over women’s health by excluding Planned Parenthood from federal funding and stripping #TitleX family planning funds that help millions of people get birth control, cancer screenings and other basic health services.

When it comes to medical research, President Trump's budget is a small step forward and a marathon sprint back. For every new penny President Trump proposes for pediatric cancer research—he proposes cutting a dollar from @NIH.

When it comes to curbing the HIV and opioid epidemics, President Trump promised solutions, but his budget would make these crises far worse by cutting over $1 trillion from Medicaid over the next decade and repealing Medicaid expansion.

President Trump’s budget bulldozes right families' concerns about their health care, with proposals that would make it harder for people to get care, and cuts that would undermine the well-being of families across the nation.

President Trump is fighting in court 
• against pre-existing condition protections 
• for bringing back annual and lifetime caps on benefits 
• for letting insurance companies offer plans that don't cover essential services like maternal care and prescription drugs.
But President Trump is fighting in court to take health care away from millions of people who are covered through the exchanges, covered through Medicaid, covered by their parents' plans, and more.

People across the country made clear last November they want us to fight for their health care—that means standing up  for protections that allow people with pre-existing conditions to get quality, affordable health coverage and bringing down skyrocketing health care costs.
